[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 144]
Reasoning: **Calculating flush strategy**

I’m evaluating my current hand: it includes cards like KH, two 9H, and a few others, making a heart flush with five hearts. This is a good position! I’m considering whether to play a Chariot to turn a card into steel for a multiplier. If I use the five hearts, I’ll be left with three clubs. Turning one club into steel could give me an extra advantage when I play the flush later. That sounds beneficial!
**Strategizing card play**

I should use the Chariot on the Jack of Clubs to enhance it with a steel card and gain a x1.5 multiplier while it's held. We only have one consumable slot, and steel persists even if it's discarded later, which is good to know. I’ll apply it to the Jack in position 6 and then play my heart flush with the first five cards. 

Since I want the first scoring card to be the King of Hearts for maximum benefit, I’ll play that first!
**Estimating chip totals**

I’m working through the play selection strategy. I'll play the cards in this order: King, and then 1 through 5 for the flush. I need to estimate the total chips. With a flush at level 4, I start with 80 base chips and a multiplier of 10. 

The Splash feature lets every card count in scoring. The values in this hand give me a total of 37 additional chips, leading to 117 chips overall. The King of Hearts will also boost my multiplier by 4. Retriggers add even more to that, which is exciting!
**Calculating multipliers and scores**

I realized that each Ancient Joker provides a x1.5 multiplier for every heart scored, and since I have two, that means each heart actually boosts the multiplier by 2.25 when scored. With five hearts, the multiplier grows significantly — it turns into 57.665, which is impressive! 

Also, the Hanging Chad feature means the King of Hearts will score three times, each time adding chips and multiplier benefits. Since Splash means retriggered cards earn their chips again, I need to start with my base chips of 80 and a multiplier of 10, making sure to score left-to-right!
**Scoring strategy breakdown**

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

#Task
Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
